field.name: creditor_id
field.title: Creditor Contact ID
field.comment: FK to Contact ID that owns that account

field.name: identifier
field.title: SEPA Creditor identifier
field.comment: Provided by the bank. ISO country code+check digit+ZZZ+country specific identifier

field.name: name
field.title: name of the creditor
field.comment: by default creditor_id.display_name snapshot at creation

field.name: country_id
field.title: Country
field.comment: Which Country does this address belong to.

field.name: tag
field.comment: Place this creditor's transaction groups in an XML file tagged with this value.

field.name: mandate_active
field.title: Immediately activate new Mandates
field.comment: If true, new Mandates for this Creditor are set to active directly upon creation; otherwise, they have to be activated explicitly later on.

field.name: sepa_file_format_id
field.title: SEPA File Format
field.comment: Variant of the pain.008 format to use when generating SEPA XML files for this creditor. FK to SEPA File Formats in civicrm_option_value.

field.name: extra_advance_days
field.title: Extra Advance Days
field.comment: How many banking days (if any) to add on top of all minimum advance presentation deadlines defined in the SEPA rulebook.

field.name: maximum_advance_days
field.title: Maximum Advance Days
field.comment: When generating SEPA XML files, include payments up to this many calender days from now. (14 is the minimum banks have to allow according to rulebook.)

field.name: use_cor1
field.title: Use COR1
field.comment: Generate SEPA XML files using "Local Instrument" COR1 instead of CORE (along with the shorter minimum advance presentation deadlines) for domestic payments.

field.name: group_batching_mode
field.title: TxGroups Batching Mode
field.comment: How to batch TxGroups into files. NONE: every TxGroup in a separate file; TYPE: one file for each Sequence Type (FRST/RCUR/OOFF); COR: one file for all COR1 and one for all CORE; ALL: single file with all groups.
